ðŸ’¡ mobile-use | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating interactions with Android and iOS apps using natural language commands.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Natural Language Control â€¢ UI-Aware Automation â€¢ Data Scraping â€¢ Extensible & Customizable
ðŸ“– Summary: The mobile-use repository provides an AI agent that enables users to automate tasks on their mobile devices using natural language. It features UI-aware automation, data scraping capabilities, and is extensible with different LLMs, allowing users to interact with and extract information from mobile apps programmatically.

âœ¨ octos | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating and sharing interactive, web-based wallpapers for Windows desktops.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Create interactive wallpapers using HTML/CSS/JS â€¢ Powered by the Octos API for Windows integration â€¢ Supports games, websites, and videos as wallpapers â€¢ Optimized for performance on various machines
ðŸ“– Summary: Octos is a dynamic desktop engine that allows users to create and share live, interactive wallpapers using web technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It leverages the Octos API to integrate with Windows features and offers a community platform for sharing creations. Octos is designed to be performant and customizable, supporting a wide range of interactive content.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ pyapp | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Runtime installer for Python applications
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Easily build standalone binaries for every platform â€¢ Optional management commands providing functionality such as self updates â€¢ Extremely configurable runtime behavior allowing for targeting of different end users
ðŸ“– Summary: PyApp is a tool designed to wrap Python applications, creating standalone, self-bootstrapping binaries for various platforms. It offers features like optional management commands for self-updates and highly configurable runtime behavior. This allows developers to easily distribute their Python applications as single executable files.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ unbaited | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Filtering unwanted content from X (Twitter) feeds using AI.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Filters engagement bait and inflammatory content from X (formerly Twitter) feeds. â€¢ Uses Groq's API for fast tweet analysis. â€¢ Blurs tweets identified as engagement bait or political. â€¢ Allows users to reveal hidden tweets with a click. â€¢ Customizable system prompt for analysis.
ðŸ“– Summary: Unbaited is a browser extension that utilizes Groq's API to analyze and filter content on X (formerly Twitter). It identifies and blurs engagement bait and inflammatory tweets, giving users control over their feed. The extension supports Chrome, Firefox, and Safari and allows for customization of the analysis process.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ rustfs | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: High-performance distributed object storage
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ High Performance â€¢ Distributed Architecture â€¢ S3 Compatibility â€¢ Data Lake Support â€¢ Open Source
ðŸ“– Summary: RustFS is a high-performance distributed object storage system built with Rust, aiming to be an alternative to MinIO. It offers features like S3 compatibility, support for data lakes, and a user-friendly experience, all while being open-source under the Apache 2.0 license. RustFS is currently under rapid development and not recommended for production use.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ harmony | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Rendering and parsing the harmony response format for use with gpt-oss models, particularly when building custom inference solutions.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Consistent formatting for rendering and parsing â€¢ High-performance Rust implementation â€¢ First-class Python support with typed stubs â€¢ Enables multiple output channels for chain of thought and tool calling â€¢ Supports tool namespaces and structured outputs
ðŸ“– Summary: The `harmony` repository provides a Rust-based renderer and parser for the harmony response format, designed for use with OpenAI's gpt-oss models. It ensures consistent formatting, supports multiple output channels, and offers both Rust and Python implementations to facilitate building custom inference solutions.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ Transfer | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Quickly transfer files between devices on a local network without using USB cables or cloud services.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Effortless LAN Sharing over HTTP â€¢ Configurable Security (IP Permissions, Password Protection) â€¢ Powerful CLI Access (curl-friendly) â€¢ Dual Browse UI (App and Web Interface) â€¢ Quick In-App Transfers (Upload, Paste)
ðŸ“– Summary: Transfer is an Android app that creates a local file server, enabling easy file sharing over Wi-Fi. It offers features like IP-based access control, password protection, and CLI support, providing a convenient alternative to USB drives or cloud storage for local network file transfers.
